message.content:
1)  Description of the Target Structure

•  Block Count and Layers  
  The model uses exactly four blocks in a single “layer.”  Two tall red halves come together around the outside to form a vertical ring (with a circular hole visible from the front), and inside that ring sit one blue cube and one green cube, intersecting at the center.

•  Spatial Arrangement  
  – The two red ring‐halves are joined side‐by‐side vertically, creating a single tall rectangular frame whose center is a circular opening.  
  – The blue cube sits in the middle of that circular opening.  
  – The green cube also sits in the same horizontal plane, touching the blue cube so that the two cubes form a cross shape when viewed from above.  

2)  Selecting the Required Blocks

From the dictionary image, you need:

•  Red ring‐half #7  
•  Red ring‐half #8  
•  Blue cube #9  
•  Green cube #10  

These blocks match the colors, shapes, and (crucially) the same orientations required by the target image.  

3)  Assembly Order

Use the following step‐by‐step sequence (you may of course place them in a slightly different order, but here is one logical approach):

{
  Step1: Move block with index 7  
  Step2: Move block with index 8  
  Step3: Move block with index 9  
  Step4: Move block with index 10  
}
